availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Paducah, Kentucky, tanner. Pennsylvania native. Married to Mary A. Eichar. Father of Mary Ann Eichar, Henry Eichar, Rebecca Eichar, Arabella Eichar, William Eichar, and Samuel Eichar. Tanner in St. Louis, Missouri, in 1850. Employed F. Hisken, Robert Hunt, and Hugh Floyd as tanners in St. Louis in 1850. Tanner in Paducah, Kentucky, in 1860. Employed William E. Piles and Samuel Brown as tanners in Paducah in 1860. Employed George Dyer as a tailor in Paducah in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Paducah in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Missouri, St. Louis County, St. Louis, South Half, p. 329A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, Paducah, District 1, p. 993.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, Paducah, District 1, p. 418A.
